channel.title: Morning Transportation
channel.description: Delivered every Monday by 10 a.m., Weekly Transportation examines the latest news in transportation and infrastructure politics and policy.

item.title: The year-end nominee race is on
item.description: The Senate Commerce Committee will weigh several major transportation nominees, including a DOT official who would fill the department’s vacant top policy role.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Ogozalek and Pavan Acharya
item.dc:contributor: By Sam Ogozalek and Pavan Acharya

item.title: Congress’ advent calendar starts now
item.description: Congress will be back in town this week after the Thanksgiving break — and there’s a lot on the transportation policy to-do list before the next holiday hiatus at month’s end.
item.dc:creator: By Pavan Acharya

item.title: Turkey Day travel test
item.description: Some of the busiest travel days of the year are coming up this week. They’ll represent the first big test of the aviation system post-shutdown.
item.dc:creator: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek
item.dc:contributor: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek

item.title: Goodbye, flight cuts
item.description: The FAA’s shutdown-related flight cuts at 40 major airports officially end today, the agency announced Sunday evening.
item.dc:creator: By Pavan Acharya and Chris Marquette
item.dc:contributor: By Pavan Acharya and Chris Marquette

item.title: Shutdown endgame in sight as flight cuts snowball
item.description: Senators have reached a deal to end the shutdown. But shutdown-related strains on the airspace won’t resolve themselves overnight.
item.dc:creator: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek
item.dc:contributor: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek

item.title: Airspace enters a crucial week as delays increase
item.description: The shutdown looks primed to surge past the 35-day mark. Will a surge in delays at airports break the stalemate between Democrats and Republicans?
item.dc:creator: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek
item.dc:contributor: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek

item.title: Empty paycheck looms for controllers
item.description: Air traffic controllers are set to miss their first full paychecks this week. It could lead to a cascade of flight disruptions.
item.dc:creator: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek
item.dc:contributor: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek

item.title: Cruz’s plane crash response set for its first Senate test
item.description: Senate Commerce this week will take up Chair Ted Cruz’s bill responding to January’s deadly midair crash near Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport.
item.dc:creator: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek
item.dc:contributor: By Pavan Acharya and Sam Ogozalek
